reviews.review_msg: Mr. Tront really cares about his students and is always willing to help. His notes are long but he gives clear tips on what's going to be on the exams and midterms. I had a great time with his projects and learned a ton about software engineering. The skills and knowledge he shared will definitely be a huge help in my future career.

He sends tons of ridiculously lengthy emails, and assignment instructions often exceed 10 pages. Some examples he provided were from 1990. The exams included questions based on his personal beliefs. This is a typical uni problem where students are forced to learn outdated methods. The project is not something you can put on your resume.

Our 276 professor's outdated methods made the class frustrating. We learned irrelevant concepts, printed thousands of lines of code, and spent most of our time on useless user manuals. The final project was a basic console-based bug report system that everyone did, with no room for creativity or modern practices. AVOID PLSS.

Would have recommended him if we were in the 90s but we're not. He is not updated and do not be fooled by his experience. Had to print out 10000's of lines of code for submission. If you're good at memorizing and writing verbatim, you'll do well. But honestly, you'd be a better software engineer if you dropped out and studied from YouTube.

His notes are disorganized. Teaches from notes that are 10 years old. Do not focus on the group project because at the end of the day you pass only if you pass the weighted average of the exams. You could get a 0 on all assignments and still pass. Save yourself. Do not make the same mistake I did. Worst prof I have ever taken a course with,

This instructor is proffessinal at talking so much. You can never get a concsice definite answer out of him. AND YES he did work to EA sometime in the 90s or 2000s but guess what WE ARE IN 2024.  He is incredibly confusing and disorganized. He has zero familiarity with modren day technology. I woulldn't recomment him to my enemy. Save yourself.

He has experience, but I think his experience is rather outdated. His lectures is mainly based on his experience and wordings, so you can't review from anything else (i.e. textbook) if you don't understand his lecture. I don't think his exams are hard, but his contents are confusing. However, he's pretty nice and sometimes funny.

He's really nice and passionate, but his exams are really painful (worth 60%). He makes us memorize, in exact words, HIS principle and HIS effort distribution, which is extremely useless and a waste of time to memorize. Most of the required readings are from the 1990s or early 2000s. I doubt they are more useful as compared to recent ones.

Pros: Caring, always happy to take questions, very approachable, genuinely super nice, loves interacting with students. Cons: forces you to memorize A LOT of unnecessary stuff for exams, submit assignments on paper. You have to physically print the codes and hand them in. (over 250 pages in total throughout the semester without exaggeration)
Incrediblely awfully bad

Russ has taught me more about software engineering then any other class I've taken. If you want to get a job, you'll enjoy this class. If you don't, then frankly you won't make it in the industry. HEAVY on group projects; difficulty will depend on your group members, but Russ does his best to help and become a manager if necessary.

I can get why his teaching style might not be everyones favourite but the "tangents" that he goes on are ALWAYS related to what we are learning at that time and from his previous work experience. Hella useful to hear in prep for co-op. He provides detailed slides and explicitly tells you what you have to memorize, and gives an in depth study guide.

Do not listen to the other reviews if you aspire to be a 10x engineer. You will have to work quite a bit, but you will learn a lot of relevant information about SWE. He responds to emails quickly, he will send emails to the entire class to answer common questions and to give hints about assignments/ midterms. He is extremely helpful. THE GOAT.

Extremely disorganized professor. Lecture notes have stories in them and you have to filter out half the thing he says in the class. He tends to get side tracked while giving his lectures. He spams emails left and right and ends up confusing us. Last minute emails for everything (assignments and exams).Do not, I repeat do not take courses with him.
Very bad experience disorganized save yourself

certified yapper. seems nice but seriously i think he just likes hearing himself talk because he says a lot without actually saying anything. havent learned anything. slides are insanely wordy and he gives unclear assignments

Disorganised,he gives us a very scammy course and call it  software engineering.
He keeps talking about his past experience and ramble all over the place.
Avoid If you wanna do a decent project that you can put on your resume.
Unclear about the instructions and cocky
The best instructor I have ever had. Period.

The worst prof ever in my university life. His assignments are useless and unclear and his exams are so long that you wont be able to finish it on time.  He copies notes from other profs which is so annoying and he sends tons of emails like essays which is frustrating. tbh I would never take any class with him again

The worst prof i have ever had in my life. Always give unclear assignments to us, and then sent us tons of emails to make changes. He failed 55 students in the 1st midterm, only 20 students passed(11 of them are in 50-60%). His lectures, notes and exams are unrelated. He always expains things in a complicated way. I won't take his courses anymore
Most of the students from the class fail their 1st midterm. His exams are extremely long. His instruction of the assignments are always unclear.

Wow. I can't think of a better prof than Russel in my university experience so far. It's not any one thing but if anything, I'd say it's the way he makes it easy to listen to his lectures and the way treats students. Very flexible. Sometimes not clear on what he's going to test you on, so you gotta read a lot, but can't complain at all.
Best professor I had at SFU. Love him dearly.
Practical prof, practical experience. One of the best prof in my university life.
Looks like Bilbo Baggins, but was a great prof...
Dr. Tront is an incredibly smart man who was very passionate about what he taught and his tests were fair. I hope he's enjoying himself at EA :)
An excellent prof.  Too bad he's gone now.
This is the best professor at SFU, ... supposedly.  How depressing.
Easy
He the best prof in Cmpt Sci, period.  Too bad he's gone :(
he's a good prof. Very smart. Too bad he's leaving teaching to work for EA. Wish him all the best!
What a great guy! Very funny during lectures, and always willing to help students.  He can get a bit arrogant, but deservedly so - he knows his stuff.
You'd better memorize all coursepacks and books before heading to his final, if you want a good grade.
Hard Midterm and final.  His assignments are good for understanding of the course.
He is funny!
Teaching is fairly thorough.  But, he is very arrogant and cocky.
Very dedicated about his work, on his email around 6 hours a day (no joke), hard class but well worth it.

Often great lectures but too much notes. A lot of mistakes in the notes too. And too much reading off the notes in class makes some lectures a bit dull. Also too many emails to keep track of in mailing list.
he's GREAT !!!
Great prof, one of the best I've had in my 4 years. Concise but lot of reading!
really nice prof, explains everything really good, good notes, interesting class
Took 370 with him too. You learn A LOT from him, very dedicated but tough
No Comments
Can anyone name a better CS prof than this guy?
good notes but heavy workload
good teaching but high workload
Interesting, but crappy assignments. Well prepared and concise.
He SUCKS !!!!!
No Comments
best CMPT prof ever. very entertaining. Outstanding lecture notes
Excellent professor with excellent attitude. Gives a lot of relevant examples
One of the most decent profz at SFU CS deparment
The best cmpt I've ever had.  Humorous. Strong industry experience.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
brings his diverse and interesting industry experiences to class.
Very informative professor
No Comments
Simply the best overall cmpt prof I've had, and I've had a lot. 275 ruled!
No Comments
